Hate's as good a thing as any to keep a person going. Better than most.
Money buys a man's silence for a time. A bolt in the heart buys it forever.

It's not easy being drunk all the time. If it were easy, everyone would do it.”;;;;;;;;;x
LOADING_TIP_7;Chaos isn't a pit. Chaos is a ladder."
There is a beast in every man and it stirs when you put a sword in his hand.
The gods have no mercy, that's why they're gods.
Power resides where men believe it resides… It’s a trick… A shadow on the wall… And ofttimes a very small man can cast a very large shadow
War makes monsters of us all.
It's the family name that lives on. It's all that lives on. Not your personal glory, not your honor... but family.
"The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword."
Fear cuts deeper than swords.
What do we say to the God of death?
Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word.
Winter is coming.
Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.
The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.
Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
“Why is it that when one man builds a wall, the next man immediately needs to know what's on the other side?"
“When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.”
“And I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples and bastards and broken things.”
“Once you’ve accepted your flaws, no one can use them against you.”
“If I look back I am lost.”
“Nothing burns like the cold.”
“Laughter is poison to fear.”
“Every flight begins with a fall.”
“Different roads sometimes lead to the same castle.”
“Give me honorable enemies rather than ambitious ones, and I'll sleep more easily by night.”
“A bruise is a lesson... and each lesson makes us better.”
“The man who fears losing has already lost.”
“There is no creature on earth half so terrifying as a truly just man.”
“I swear to you, sitting a throne is a thousand times harder than winning one.”
“A lord must learn that sometimes words can accomplish what swords cannot.”
“If a man paints a target on his chest, he should expect that sooner or later someone will loose an arrow on him.”
“You wear your honor like a suit of armor... You think it keeps you safe, but all it does is weigh you down and make it hard for you to move.”
“You can't hammer tin into iron, no matter how hard you beat it, but that doesn't mean it's useless.”
“Why is it always the innocents who suffer most, when you high lords play your game of thrones?”
“The heart lies and the head plays tricks with us, but the eyes see true.”
“A lion doesn't concern itself with the opinion of sheep.”
“A true man does what he will, not what he must.”
“The world was full of cravens who pretended to be heroes
column3: it took a queer sort of courage to admit to cowardice...”

column2: “A man who won't listen can't hear.”
“Minds are like swords, I do fear. The old ones go to rust.”
“You must put these dreams aside, they will only break your heart.”
“Only a man who's been burned knows what hell is truly like.”
“Everything's better with some wine in the belly.”
“The years leech at a man's memories, even those he has vowed never to forget.”
“Even in dreams, you could not fall forever.”
“...grief can derange even the strongest and most disciplined of minds.”
“A long summer always meant a long winter to come.”
“We only make peace with our enemies. That's why it's called making peace.”
“In life, the monsters win.”
“You are an honest and honorable man...Ofttimes I forget that. I have met so few of them in my life.”
“They say night's beauties fade at dawn, and the children of wine are oft disowned in the morning light.”
“Do the dead frighten you?”
“It seemed cruel for a day to dawn so fair and end so foul as this one promised to.”
“A mad man sees what he sees.”
“Folly and desperation are ofttimes hard to tell apart.”
“Spikes, he sighed. Heads. Walls.”
“Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
“There are things to be learned even from the dead.”
“Let them see that their words can cut you and you’ll never be free of the mockery.”
“In real life, the hardest aspect of the battle between good and evil is determining which is which.”
“A thousand deaths would still be less than he deserves.”
“How do you fight someone if you can't hit them?”
“You are a woman, my lady,"
“All men carry murder in their hearts, yet even so, the poisoner is beneath contempt.”
“None of us is ever ready”
“Summer is the time for squabbles. In winter, we must protect one another, keep each other warm, share our strengths.”
